by default no ports are closed in ubuntu: I would think that all unused ports in Ubuntu are closed.
IMHO if you install a daemon or server, I think that's when the corresponding port is opened
How do you know they are closed? It's probably related to port forwarding on your router
try running Transmission, then do a "netstat -4" (-4 if you're using ipv4)
sorry I forgot "netstat -4n" (-n so that ports will be shown as numbers)
In your local address column, look for the port number you opened in Transmission. You can do it with "netstat -4n | grep <port number>"
are you running Transmission already? Like activating a torrent?
just to be sure if you followed correctly. If the port you want to open is 12345, your command should look like "netstat -4n | grep 12345"
It could be a firewall problem (iptables, and the like). I'm sorry I couldn't help any further...
you could also look into AppArmor. I haven't tinkered with that, but it could be related
